snippet: Bill de Blasio, the New York City public advocate, also criticized the City Council speaker Christine C. Quinn, calling her small-business proposal “a joke.”
abstract: New York Public Advocate Bill de Blasio lays out a provocative plan to finance education programs by raising income taxes on New York City's wealthiest residents; likely mayoral candidate in 2013 hopes his populist appeal and attacks on rival, City Council Speaker Christine Quinn, will resonate with voters.
lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio, the New York City public advocate, also criticized the City Council speaker Christine C. Quinn, calling her small-business proposal “a joke.”

headline.seo: Bill De Blasio Proposes Higher Taxes on Wealthy to Pay for Education
headline.main: Higher Taxes in de Blasio’s Schools Push
headline.print_headline: Higher Taxes in de Blasio’s Schools Push
